record.dc:title: 804CP5(H) Irwin Village Site 12CP5, Campbell County, Tennessee. Mound 1. Feature 26, Structure 1, a rectangular structure at the south end of the mound.
record.wpa:narrative: See charts. This structure was surrounded by four ditches averaging 18" in depth and approximately 14" in width. The ditches were filled with dark loam with a double row of posts in the ditch, one row down the center (?), the other along the inner edge. Along the outer edge of the ditch and standing on edge were numerous stones (lime and sand) which apparently were used to assist in supporting and steadying the posts of the walls. With the exception of the east wall, it was difficult to trace the post molds in the ditches due to the fact that the ditches were filled with soft black loam which held no impression of the mold and made digging and tracing of the molds impossible. However, on the north end of the structure a portion of the ditch was covered with hard clay which preserved the post molds in excellent shape and the ditch and relationship of these molds has been photographed. (5-291 and 5-292).
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photographs CP5(HH) [fhm00508], 5-204 [fhm00553], 5-205 [fhm00554], 5-286 [fhm00571] 5-287 [fhm00572], 5-291 [fhm00576], 789CP5(B) [fhm00600], CP5(C) [fhm00601], and 805CP5(I) [fhm00607].
